addressleaf.section:
T
o out trusty and welbelovid Thomas Wilk
and Thomas Bodley
esq
rs
, our servitors in the
L
owe Co
u
tryes
/.

page.lettertext:
fol.219r
Belgia: 1590: July
Belgia 1590 20 July
Elizabeth R
By the Queene./
Trusty and welbeloved, wee greete yow well. Whereas
mons
r
Snoy
otherwise called Sonoy, who had charge in the
Prince of Oreng
tyme in
North
Holland
, and afterward was Cap
ne
and Governo
r
of
Medenblicke
,
hath enfourmed us, that the
States G
n
rall
, and the
Conte Maurice
have
not observed such appointment
and articles, as was concluded betwixt them
and him, at the tyme that he delyvered the sayed towne of Medenblick
to the sayed Conte and Stat
, whereby he ys endaungered to the Burgesse
of the Towne, and his estate otherwise empayred in not obteynynge such
thing
as were promised to him for his benefite, as by a Remonstrance
w
ch
he hath presented to us in writinge and w
ch
wee have willed our
Threasorer of England
to send herew
th
unto yow, shall more largely ap
e.
Wee havinge had good cawse for the goodwill and dutifull
s
rvice, w
ch
he allwayes
fessed to render to us to the Publicke benefite of
e Contrie,
do will and moste ernestly requyre you both, after ye have considered of
his cawse by the sayed Remonstrance, and by the further informacion
of such, as he will direct to attend uppon you, that you do diligently
imparte his whole cause to the States Generall, and to all the
Cownsell
of Estate
, and as occasion may serve to the Conte Maurice, and Requyre
them as they will have us thincke that they have regard to content us, to
heare his complaintes, and give favourable aunswers to his demaund
,
and to satisfy him in all matters accordinge to the promises made to him,
when he did render the Governement. W
ch
also wee have more cause
to requyre of them bicause he did yeld to all their demaundes uppon
such solicitac
o
n as by our c
o
maundement was made to him, by o
r
Lieutenant
Generall the
L. Willoughby
, and our Cownsello
r
He nry Killegrewe
,
w
ch
wee did to content the Estates accordinge to their request
. And
though at your furst motion (yt may be) you shall not have a redy and
favourable aunswere: Yet wee will you in tymes convenient to reiterate
our request
, and not to disiste from the same, w
th
out some relief of him
and his causes.
Gyven under our Signet at our Mannor of
Grenwich the xx
th
of July
1590.
in the xxxij
th
year of our
Raigne/.
